title: 111_hr3365
content: The Act titled "Medicare VA Reimbursement Act of 2009" establishes a Medicare subvention for veterans. The "Medicare VA Reimbursement Act of 2009" amends the Social Security Act to establish a program where the Secretary of Health and Human Services reimburses the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for non-service-connected medical treatments provided to Medicare-eligible veterans at VA medical facilities. The Medicare VA Reimbursement Act of 2009 establishes a program for reimbursing the VA for non-service-connected medical treatments for Medicare-eligible veterans at VA facilities. A memorandum of understanding between HHS and the VA will outline the program's administration details. The Medicare VA Reimbursement Act of 2009 establishes a program for reimbursing the VA for non-service-connected medical treatments for Medicare-eligible veterans at VA facilities. An agreement is needed for frequency of reimbursement, billing system details, and data sharing between HHS and the VA. The Medicare VA Reimbursement Act of 2009 establishes a program for reimbursing the VA for non-service-connected medical treatments for Medicare-eligible veterans at VA facilities, including verification of data demonstrating services provided before reimbursement. The Medicare VA Reimbursement Act of 2009 outlines payment rates, performance measures, and additional terms for the Medicare VA reimbursement program, without a maintenance of effort requirement for the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The Medicare VA Reimbursement Act of 2009 exempts the Secretary of Veterans Affairs from a maintenance of effort requirement for reimbursement from the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will reimburse the Secretary of Veterans Affairs based on regular Medicare payment rates for services provided to Medicare-eligible veterans at VA medical facilities. The Veterans Affairs medical facility can treat non-service-connected conditions for Medicare-eligible veterans at a rate of 100 percent of Medicare payment rates on a fee-for-service basis. The Veterans Affairs medical facility can treat non-service-connected conditions for Medicare-eligible veterans at a rate determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services in consultation with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, without arbitrary limitations on reimbursement amounts. The payment under subparagraph (A) excludes amounts related to Disproportionate Share Hospital Adjustment, Direct Graduate Medical Education Payments, Indirect Medical Education Adjustment, and Capital Payments. Periodic payments from Medicare Trust are also excluded. Reimbursements under this paragraph for Medicare Trust funds are made periodically from specific trust funds. Payments made to the Department of Veterans Affairs under this subsection are deposited into the Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Care Collections Fund. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will reduce reimbursement to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for items and services under the Medicare VA reimbursement program by amounts related to deductible, coinsurance, and cost-sharing requirements. Payments to Federal providers of services under certain sections will not be prohibited for items and services provided under this subsection. The Department of Health and Human Services is restricted from investigating expenditure of funds under this subsection, including compliance with relevant laws. It cannot add criteria for eligibility for health care benefits for veterans or limit a veteran's access to benefits. Annual reports must be submitted one year after implementing the program. The administering Secretaries must submit an annual report to Congress on the program's implementation. The report should include the number of Medicare-eligible veterans opting for care at VA facilities, total reimbursements made to the VA from specific trust funds, and details on items and services provided to Medicare-eligible veterans. The annual report to Congress on the Medicare VA reimbursement program must include details on funds expended, changes to the memorandum of understanding, performance data comparison, and any other relevant data determined by the administering Secretaries. The term 'administering Secretaries' refers to the Secretary of Health and Human Services and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs acting jointly. A 'Medicare-eligible veteran' is a veteran eligible for care under specific sections of title 38, United States Code, and enrolled in Medicare Part A or Part B. The term 'non-service-connected condition' refers to a disease or condition that is not related to military service. The term 'Department of Veterans Affairs medical facility' means a medical facility under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. A new subsection is added to Section 1729 of title 38, United States Code regarding Medicare-eligible veterans. The Secretary must seek reimbursement from the Secretary of Health and Human Services for care provided to Medicare-eligible veterans for non-service-connected conditions. They must also collect any applicable deductible or coinsurance from the veteran or a third party. They must also collect any applicable deductible or coinsurance from the veteran or a third party. SEC. 3. GAO REPORT. The Comptroller General of the United States must submit a report to Congress every three years on the Medicare VA reimbursement program's impact on the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund. The report will also analyze whether Medicare-eligible veterans experience improved access to health care. The report will analyze the impact of the Medicare VA reimbursement program on Medicare-eligible veterans' access to healthcare, quality of care, local healthcare providers, and surrounding communities. Additional issues may also be addressed as deemed appropriate by the Comptroller General of the United States. The Congress believes that funds for VA medical care should not be reduced due to the Medicare VA reimbursement program.
